fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.auth

Interface IAuthzService

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IPlatformAuthzService

    public interface IAuthzService
    An authorization service, providing information about permissions, determining what a user can see and do within the application.

    Different implementations can manage different sets of permissions and different types of secure objects.

    Thread safety: implementations are required to be safe for concurrent read/write access.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies
    See Also:
    IConnector.getAuthorizationService()

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean allows(IUser user, ISecure secureObject, IPermission permission)
      Determines if the specified user has a specific permission for accessing the specified secure object.
      boolean canPermit(ISecure secureObject)
      Indicates if this authorization service can check permissions for the specified secure object.
      IPermission getPermission(String permissionName)
      Gets a specific permission by name, if managed by this authorization service.
      List<IPermission> getPermissions()
      Lists all the permissions that may be managed by this authorization service.
      List<IPermission> getPermissions(IUser user, ISecure secureObject)
      Lists all the permissions are granted by this authorization service to a specific user for accessing a specific secure object.

    • Method Detail

      • getPermission

        IPermission getPermission(String permissionName)
        Gets a specific permission by name, if managed by this authorization service.
        Parameters:
        permissionName - name of the permission to get.
        Returns:
        the requested permission, or null.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IPermission.getName()

      • getPermissions

        List<IPermission> getPermissions()
        Lists all the permissions that may be managed by this authorization service.

        The list may contain the default permissions (CREATE, READ, UPDATE, and DELETE), but this is not a requirement. The list can include different permissions, including alternative permissions or a subset or superset of the default permissions.

        Returns:
        a non-null list of permissions that are supported by this authorization service.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getPermissions

        List<IPermission> getPermissions(IUser user,
                                 ISecure secureObject)
        Lists all the permissions are granted by this authorization service to a specific user for accessing a specific secure object.
        Parameters:
        user - the non-null user to evaluate.
        secureObject - the non-null secure object to evaluate.
        Returns:
        a list of permissions that are granted by this authorization service to the specific user for the specified secure object. This should return an empty list when the authorization service can manage permissions for the secure object, when there are no permissions for the user for the specified secure object. When the authorization service does not manage secure object type, it may return null.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        canPermit(ISecure)

      • canPermit

        boolean canPermit(ISecure secureObject)
        Indicates if this authorization service can check permissions for the specified secure object.
        Parameters:
        secureObject - object to evaluate.
        Returns:
        true if this authorization service can check permissions for the specified secure object, otherwise false.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        allows(IUser, ISecure, IPermission), getPermissions()

      • allows

        boolean allows(IUser user,
               ISecure secureObject,
               IPermission permission)
        Determines if the specified user has a specific permission for accessing the specified secure object.
        Parameters:
        user - the non-null user to evaluate.
        secureObject - the non-null secure object to evaluate.
        permission - the non-null permission to check.
        Returns:
        true if the permission is granted, otherwise false.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        canPermit(ISecure)
